WRITING.TITLE: Question about alternate picking...
WRITING.TEXT: So... Long story short, I'm a 100% self taught guitarist. I most likely know what alternate picking is I just didn't know the word for it before, but just in case can someone explain what alternate picking is so I can understand what you guys are talking about? haha

I normally start with music. 1. Choose a feel or mood you want to portray 2. Put together a simple chord progression or guitar part that has the feel you're looking for 3. Add all of the little bells and whistles and embellishments that finish the music out 4.play the song as many times as possible with an open mind(don't search for lyrics just let them come to you) 5. Make the lyrics whatever the song makes you feel That's my usual process :) It usually works for me because I am letting the song speak through me, not the other way around
Haha I think that is the most hilarious comment I've ever read on this sub Well played sir
I learned completely on my own. And now 8 years later I feel like I'm pretty good

Thanks for that obvious advice dude hahaha But really the weight of the les Paul does give it a slightly different tone because of the way the the sound resonates through the wood so it does slightly matter I was really asking for more guitar choices that have a similar tone to a les Paul that have a more unique look

It's not what other people think that I'm worried about haha It's what I think about it hahaha I love uniquely shaped guitars because they represent who I am But I do agree that the tone of the guitar is what is most important

WRITING.TITLE: Help deciding what guitar Will be best for my sound
WRITING.TEXT:
I play rhythm guitar in a pop punk band with a lot of blues/Americana influences thrown in the mix. I know the obvious choice for me would be a les Paul, but everyone plays a les paul and I would really like a unique look. Does any body have any ideas as to what guitars would be the best for me? (I've been thinking about getting a SG solely because of the looks, but I don't know if it's the right choice sound-wise) my max price is going to be around 1700
EDIT: I said I would like a unique sound, when I really meant to say unique look.
